content: What are the best docs for learning & using Roc these days? (Other than the tutorial)

I would suggest all the links on the "Docs" page as well, if you haven't looked at those yet: https://www.roc-lang.org/docs. Starting from "Guides", then "Language Reference" and then the top section (the one with the platforms).

Additionally, you could have a look at AoC repos such as the following:

  • https://github.com/smores56/aoc-2023
  • https://github.com/lukewilliamboswell/aoc

As well as blogs:

  • https://lukewilliamboswell.github.io/
  • https://sammohr.dev/blog/announcing-weaver

Awesome Roc:

  • https://github.com/lukewilliamboswell/roc-awesome

Naturally, the #beginners and #contributing streams are great learning resources as well!

In summary, just as ChatGPT might say:
Happy learning! :smiley:
